bwwExcerpt: Were it not for Lane's participation, "Gary" might have premiered instead at the Public Theater or another Off-Broadway venue open to its combination of Shakespeare, physical comedy and sincerity. One can't help but admire Lane's willingness to take part in an unpredictable new work instead of another revival. He gives an absolutely committed performance as a sad and sensitive clown/struggling everyman while being backed by two superb comic actresses.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Directed with old-fashioned panache by George C. Wolfe, ‘Gary’ proves to be an intermittently amusing but primarily bewildering experience — like a five-minute vaudeville sketch that has been uncomfortably stretched to 95 minutes...One can’t help but admire Lane’s willingness to take part in an unpredictable new work...He gives an absolutely committed performance as a sad and sensitive clown/struggling everyman while being backed by two superb comic actresses."
